title: New version of Thunderbird
content:
I immediately ran into a problem with the new version of Thunderbird. I use 3 email accounts and the update erased and/or changed the password when sending a message. I received emails without a problem, but they would not transmit. A popup window appeared asking for a new password. Clicking on that only resent the message. I went to the saved passwords and was able to re-enter my passwords on these accounts. Using windows 10. Note that there were no problems with passwords on my Ipad.

One other problem. in the messages area (subject, correspondents, date), I cannot adjust the number of messages seen. I can expand it, but not reduce it. For instance, it currently shows 8 messages, but I cannot change it to 6, or 4. I did find that I could adjust the font size - thanks.

LIke others, I still prefer the previous version.
creator: bobh42

title: Can not print a DRAFT message open in compose window
content:
I routinely print messages right before I send them** and Thunderbird v115.3.2 doesn't let me do that. It acts like it's going to do it, but then nothing happens. I'm on a Mac, and if I choose "Save as PDF" from the PDF Services menu, literally nothing is saved. This tells me that Thunderbird is acting like it is going to print something, but doesn't actually pass anything to macOS to print.

If, I save it in Drafts and then go to the Drafts mailbox and print from there, it works as expected, but that's a lot of extra steps.

It seems this same bug happened a number of years ago: [Can no longer print a DRAFT message open in compose] and was classified as a bug and fixed. Hopefully the same can happen again?

Thanks!

    • OK, I don't print them, I save them as PDFs, but the workflow and problem is the same.
creator: DaveTheNerd

title: Emails not opening
content: I am using version 115.3.2 and have not had a problem until today. About 7:15 PM while reading through my emails, Thunderbird disappeared and I got a blue screen message that an error had occurred, but before I could read further, my PC went blank. The power light was still on, so I waited several minutes, but nothing was happening (no restart). I did a manual shutdown and rebooted. The system seemed to load normally. I went back to Thunderbird to pick up where I left off on the emails. The list of emails was there, but when I clicked on the next one in the queue, nothing happened. A double click opened a blank page, not the email. I checked a few others, and the same thing happened. This was with my main email account from Optimum. I checked my other accounts (AOL and gmail), and they appear unaffected; emails opened normally. I sent an email to the Optimum account from both of the others, and they opened normally. After some checking, this "blank page" situation seems to start with emails in the inbox from 9/21/2023 and continue to today (10/15/2023) at around 7:15 PM. Older emails are still there. I have many folders for old emails, and I checked several of them. The old emails are still there, including ones between 9/21 and 10/15. All the blank emails from today seem to be OK when downloaded on Windows Mail. I signed into my Optimum account online, and all the emails seem to be there. This all seems very strange. I would hope there is some way to repopulate these blank emails.
creator: hasmort
